results.definition: the meaning of a word or expression; the way in which a word or expression or situation can be interpreted
examples: the dictionary gave several senses for the word
in the best sense charity is really a duty

results.definition: perceive by a physical sensation, e.g., coming from the skin or muscles

examples: Common sense is not so common
he hasn't got the sense God gave little green apples
fortunately she had the good sense to run away

results.definition: become aware of not through the senses but instinctively
the faculty through which the external world is apprehended
examples: in the dark he had to depend on touch and on his senses of smell and hearing
I sensed the real meaning of his letter

results.definition: detect some circumstance or entity automatically
examples: This robot can sense the presence of people in the room
